intro: Rhabdotheca brunneri, commonly known as the Brunner's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Rhabdotheca brunneri is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained conditions.
